parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1
Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field TR.STUDYID

fields.definition: A unique identifier for a study.
fields.implementationNotes: While this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or the EDC system. This field can be included into the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.
fields.label: Study Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: STUDYID

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field TR.SITEID

fields.definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. EDC: This should be prepopulated.
fields.label: Study Site Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: SITEID

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field TR.SUBJID

fields.completionInstructions: Record the identifier for the subject.
fields.definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTM Implementation Guide.
fields.label: Subject Identifier for the Study
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: SUBJID

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field TR.VISIT

fields.definition: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.
fields.implementationNotes: This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is represented only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to SDTM Table 2.2.4.
fields.label: Visit Name
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: VISIT

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field TR.VISDAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using DD-MON-YYYY format.
fields.definition: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).
fields.implementationNotes: If the date the test was collected can be determined from the Visit Date variable (VISDAT), apply that date to all of the tests at that visit, or the collection date can be collected on the CRF using the date (TRDAT). In this domain, it may not be appropriate to use the vist date as TRDTC.
fields.label: Visit Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This field is not an SDTM variable. If the date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable TRDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: VISDAT
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field TR.TRLNKGRP

fields.completionInstructions: If collected on the CRF, sponsor may insert instructions to ensure each record has the appropriate identifier.
fields.definition: An identifier used to link related records across domains.
fields.implementationNotes: Because TRLNKGRP is a sponsor-defined identifier, conformance to Question Text or Item Prompt is not applicable. This is typically used in oncology clincial trials. It is intended to group all the assessments at a evaluation time point represented in the TR domain with the associated response assessments represented in the RS domain.
fields.label: Tumor/Lesion Result Link Group
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: TRLNKGRP

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field TR.TRCAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the Tumor/Lesion Result category, if not preprinted on the CRF.
fields.definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a preprinted category value on the CRF, and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header.
fields.label: Category of Tumor/Lesion Result
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: TRCAT
fields.questionText: What is the category of the [tumor/lesion] results?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field TR.TRSCAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the Tumor/Lesion Result subcategory, if not preprinted on the CRF.
fields.definition: A subgrouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be preprinted on the CRF or screen and prepopulated in the data management system. This is not typically a question to which the site would provide an answer. TRSCAT can only be used if there is an TRCAT and it must be a subcategorization of TRCAT.
fields.label: Subcategory of Tumor/Lesion Result
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: TRSCAT
fields.questionText: What is the subcategory of the [tumor/lesion] results?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66789

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field TR.TRSTAT

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate if the [Tumor/Lesion] evaluation was not done.
fields.definition: The variable used to indicate that data are not available by having the site record the value as "Not Done".
fields.implementationNotes: A Not Done check box, which indicates the test was NOT DONE. Typically, there would be one check box for each result. This field can be useful to confirm that a blank result field is meant to be blank.
fields.label: Tumor/Lesion Result Completion Status
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: TRSTAT
fields.questionText: Indicate if the [tumor/lesion] evaluation was not done.

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field TR.TRREASND

fields.completionInstructions: Provide the reason the result was not provided.
fields.definition: An explanation of why the data are not available.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology may be used. The reason the data are not available may be chosen from a sponsor-defined codelist (e.g., broken equipment, subject refused) or entered as free text. When TRREASND is used, TRSTAT should also be populated in the SDTM-based dataset.
fields.label: Reason Tumor Measurement Not Performed
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: TRREASND
fields.questionText: What was the reason that the [tumor/lesion] was not [evaluated/assessed]?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C78735

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field TR.TREVAL

fields.completionInstructions: Select the role of the person who provided the evaluation (e.g., INVESTIGATOR, ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE, VENDOR).
fields.definition: The role of the person who provided the information.
fields.implementationNotes: Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). May be a preprinted or collected. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.
fields.label: Tumor/Lesion Result Evaluator
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: TREVAL
fields.questionText: Who provided the information? OR Who was the evaluator?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C96777

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field TR.TREVALID

fields.completionInstructions: Record the unique identifier assigned to the person making the evaluation.
fields.definition: Used to distinguish multiple evaluators with the same role.
fields.implementationNotes: Collect if multiple evaluators are used in the study (may be omitted if multiple evaluators are not used); values should follow controlled terminology.
fields.label: Tumor/Lesion Result Evaluator Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: TREVALID
fields.questionText: What was the identifier of the evaluator?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field TR.TRDAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the date when the method used to assess the tumor/lesion occurred using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.definition: The date of the procedure used for tumor/lesion assessment, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.implementationNotes: This is the date of the scan/image/physical exam used to evaluate the tumor/lesion. It is not the date the MRI or scan was read. This is typically not the visit date.
fields.label: Tumor/Lesion Result Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable TRDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: TRDAT
fields.questionText: What was the date of the procedure used for [tumor/lesion] assessment?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field TR.TRLNKID

fields.completionInstructions: If collected, record the unique identifier for this tumor/lesion.
fields.definition: An identifier used to link identified tumor/lesion to the assessment result.
fields.implementationNotes:
This variable is used to provide a unique code for each identified tumor in order to link records across related CRFs (TU and TR) when appropriate. Sponsors develop their own conventions for populating --LNKID. Typically, the lesion/tumor is assigned the --LNKID at baseline when the tumor/lesion is identified, and this --LNKID is used at other visits to collect assessments on this tumor /lesion. 
 Note: This variable may be collected using one CDASH variable name (e.g., TULNKID) and populated into TRLNKID when the submisson datasets are created.
fields.label: Tumor/Lesion Result Link ID
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: TRLNKID

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C96778

implements.title: Name of Measurement, Test or Examination

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field TR.TRTEST

fields.completionInstructions: Record the name of the tumor lesion assessment, if not preprinted on the CRF. If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may provide additional instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.
fields.definition: Descriptive name of the measurement or finding.
fields.implementationNotes: Required to identify which test the result is for. It is recommended that the test names be preprinted on the CRF rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test" can be included as the column header.
fields.label: Tumor/Lesion Assessment Test Name
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. The SDTMIG variable TRTESTCD may be determined from the value collected in TRTEST. The SDTMIG variables TRTESTCD and TRTEST are required in the SDTM submission datasets. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.
fields.name: TRTEST
fields.questionText: What was the [tumor/ lesion] (assessment) test name?

implements.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field TR.TRORRES

sdtmigDatasetMappingTargets.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

self.title: TR Result or Finding in Original Units

fields.implementationNotes: Result of the tumor/lesion assessment. Both quantitative and qualitatve results may be recorded here.
fields.label: TR Result or Finding in Original Units
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. In addition to the SDTMIG variable TRORRES, create TRTESTCD from the CDASH variable name and determine the value of TRTEST from TRTESTCD. The CDASH prompt may also contain the TRTEST. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.
fields.name: TRORRES
fields.questionText: What is the result for the [tumor/lesion assessment]?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71620

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field TR.TRORRESU

fields.completionInstructions: Record or select the original units in which these data were collected, if not preprinted on CRF.
fields.definition: The unit of the result as originally received or collected.
fields.implementationNotes: Usually the unit of the test is preprinted on the CRF.
fields.label: TR Original Units
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: TRORRESU
fields.questionText: What was the unit of the [result/measurement]?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field TR.TRNAM

fields.completionInstructions: Record the name of the vendor providing the evaluation.
fields.definition: The name or identifier of the vendor (e.g., laboratory) that provided the test results.
fields.implementationNotes: Recommended to collect on the CRF if vendor names was not collected at the site/study level or if multiple vendors are used by a site.
fields.label: Tumor/Lesion Result Vendor Name
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: TRNAM
fields.questionText: What was the name of the vendor used?
